game.title: Oh No! It's THE HORDE!
menu.biome.title: Which region?
help.dialogue.intro: You have been tasked with protecting this village from the hordelings. As you move around, the calendar will progress through the month. On the 30th day, the horde will attack.
help.dialogue.controls: Move around with the arrow keys. Switch through your abilities with 'q' and 'e'. Use an ability with Space.
help.dialogue.money: Peasants, crops, and other items will grant you income. Some abilities will cost gold coins to activate. A few will cost gold to maintain each season.At the end of each year, the king will expect a certain amount of taxes, so set some money aside.
help.dialogue.money_pt2: By the way, you can use your 'Sell Things' ability to sell Trees to get some initial income.
help.dialogue.attacks: There are many kinds of hordelings, and the strength of the attacks will increase with time. You should build defenses and hire warriors to help fight against their onslaught.
message.start.protect: You have been tasked with protecting the peasants of the Toshim Plains.
message.start.horde: At the end of each season, the horde will come, ravenous in hunger.
message.start.help: Press the 'h' key if you need help.
message.reset_health: You rest and your wounds heal.
message.contract_fees: You racked up {amount}c in contract fees.
message.peasants_dead: All of the peasants were killed! The king will have your head for this. Game Over.
message.horde_arrival: The Horde has arrived. Prepare to defend the village!
warning.contract_quitters: Several mercenaries abandoned you, because you could not pay them.
warning.king_collects: The king will collect {amount}c from you at the end of the year.
warning.no_money: You can't afford to use that ability.
warning.player_dead_no_action: You urge your lifeless corpse to action, without much success.
popup.king_collects_insufficient: The king attempted to collect {amount}c, but you only had {gold}c! For this, your life is forfeit. Game Over.
popup.king_collects_paid: The king collected {amount}c from you at the end of the year. Next year, the amount will be {next_amount}c.
